mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Particular draughts and plans of some of the principal towns and harbours belonging to the English, French, and Spaniards, in America and West Indies

datafield.subfield: Particular draughts and plans of some of the principal towns and harbours belonging to the English, French, and Spaniards, in America and West Indies :
Relief shown pictorially; depths shown by soundings.
Published in the author's A complete atlas or distinct view of the know world. London : W. Innys, 1752.

A draught of Boston harbour -- The harbour of Placentia -- The harbour of Anapolis Royal -- A plan of the town and harbour of Louisbourg in the island of Cape Breton ... -- A draught of New York and Perthamboy Harbour -- Harbour of St. Augustine -- The Harbour of Providence -- The Havana -- Bay of St. Jago de Cuba -- The town and harbour of Charles Town in South Carolina -- Fort Royal in Martinico -- A plan of the town and harbour of Cartagena -- A plan of the harbour town and forts of Porto Bello, when taken by Admiral Vernon on Nov. 22d. 1739 with 6 ships only.

METS:xmlData.rightsmd:versionStatement: Electronic version created 2010, University of South Florida Tampa Library
